line_1: Sooner shall want sieze shepherds of the south,
line_2: And we forget to live from hand to mouth,

line_1: Thy kindling eye-balls brave the glaring south,
line_2: And dreadful is the thunder of thy mouth:

line_1: For a wooer that comes when the sun's i' the south,
line_2: He hem'd and he haw'd, and he drew in his mouth,

line_1: When the Wind's in the Point which opposes the South,
line_2: For Fear of the Cold, I can't open my Mouth:

line_1: And seeks on winnowing fin the breezy South;
line_2: Waves his broad tail, and opes his ribbed mouth,

line_1: His mass enormous to the affrighted South;
line_2: Steers with expanded eye and gaping mouth,

line_1: Sweeter than Breezes of her native South;
line_2: To take the fragrant Kisses of his Mouth,

line_1: Between the North pole and the South;
line_2: That e'er were broach'd from Folly's mouth,

line_1: The muckle devil blaw you south,
line_2: Stand forth and tell yon PREMIER YOUTH,

line_1: The muckle devil blaw you south,
The muckle devil blaw you south,
line_2: Tell him o' mine an' Scotland's drouth,
